summary: Cormorants and shags are a family of aquatic birds with around 40 species. They are medium to large-sized, weighing between 0.77 to 11 pounds, and have dark feathers, long hooked bills, and webbed feet. These birds are excellent fishers, diving to catch their prey, and can swim up to 150 feet deep. They nest in colonies near shores, trees, or cliffs. You can find them worldwide, except in the central Pacific islands.
title: Cormorant
